summary: This document is a detailed timeline of events surrounding the suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It chronicles his activities on August 9, 2019, the discovery of his body on August 10, the emergency response, official notifications, and subsequent investigations by the FBI and OIG over the following days.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell on August 10, 2019, and later pronounced dead. The timeline details his final day and the response to his death.

persons.name: Reyes Efrain
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who departed for court on the morning of August 9, 2019, as noted in the timeline.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge was notified of Epstein's death at 10:00 am on August 10, 2019, and later provided with a press release.

connections.description: Reyes Efrain is explicitly identified as Epstein's cellmate in the SHU.

events.title: Epstein's Final Day
events.description: Epstein spends the day in attorney conferences. In the evening, he is provided a social call and reported to be in good spirits.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm is activated. Staff find Epstein unresponsive in his cell. CPR is initiated, EMS is called, and he is transported to Beekman Hospital.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: At 7:36 am, the ER physician reports the official time of death. Next of kin (brother) is notified later that morning.

events.title: Investigations Begin
events.description: The FBI and OIG are notified and arrive at the MCC to investigate the incident. Computer hard drives from the SHU are removed for evidence.

events.title: Staff Recall and FBI Investigation
events.description: A staff recall is conducted, and the FBI returns to the institution multiple times throughout the day and evening.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York SHU at 6:33 am on Saturday, August 10, 2019.
Epstein had been in 'good spirits' during a social call the previous evening at 7:00 pm on August 9, according to an IDO report.
His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, had departed for court the morning before the incident.
The official time of death was reported by an ER physician at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.
Computer hard drives from the SHU were removed and replaced by a Computer Services Manager on the night of Epstein's death, indicating a seizure of potential evidence.
